intro: Calochortus maweanus, commonly known as the Mawea globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Calochortus maweanus has lance-shaped leaves and produces a distinctive, globular inflorescence that gives it its common name. It is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil.
